name: Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
description: These Vegan Cinnamon Roll Pancakes use my multi-grain pancake mix. Delicious breakfast with With swirls of cinnamon sugar. gluten-free option
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup Kamut (or barley, rye, sorghum, millet, buckwheat flour)
1/4 cup ground raw sugar or other sugar finely ground (or add sweetener/stevia later while making pancake batter)
1 cup Regular Pancake Mix ((above) or use my Gluten-free Pancake Mix (see recipe notes for link))
1 Tablespoon oil or melted Earth balance
3 Tablespoon ground raw sugar or coconut sugar

itemListElement.text: Mix everything well with a whisk and store. Use Arrowroot starch to make corn-free.
itemListElement.name: Mix everything well with a whisk and store. Use Arrowroot starch to make corn-free.

itemListElement.text: Whisk everything well and refrigerate while you get the pancake mix ready.
itemListElement.name: Whisk everything well and refrigerate while you get the pancake mix ready.

itemListElement.text: Add the lemon juice to 1/3 cup water. Add the almond milk, water, oil, cinnamon to the dry pancake mix. Mix until just combined and let sit for 2 minutes. If the mixture feels too thick(it is thicker than plain flour pancake mix), then add a tablespoon more water.
itemListElement.name: Add the lemon juice to 1/3 cup water. Add the almond milk, water, oil, cinnamon to the dry pancake mix. Mix until just combined and let sit for 2 minutes. If the mixture feels too thick(it is thicker than plain flour pancake mix), then add a tablespoon more water.

itemListElement.text: Heat the pan on medium heat. Grease with a little oil. Once the pan is hot, pour ladle full (1/4 cup) of the pancake batter for each pancake. Spread the batter a bit with the ladle if needed. Let it cook for about half a minute till it starts to bubble on the edges. Make circles on top with the cinnamon sugar filling(using a spoon or the sandwich bag method). Do not make the swirls too close to the edge of the pancake. Cover the pan for a minute. Let it cook until bubbles form in the center(3-4 minutes). Flip the pancake and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from the pan, stack and serve hot with maple syrup, a dollop of Earth balance or coconut cream drizzle.
itemListElement.name: Heat the pan on medium heat. Grease with a little oil. Once the pan is hot, pour ladle full (1/4 cup) of the pancake batter for each pancake. Let it cook until bubbles form in the center(3-4 minutes). Flip the pancake and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from the pan, stack and serve hot with maple syrup, a dollop of Earth balance or coconut cream drizzle.
